intro: Oenothera hardhamiae, commonly known as the hardham's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, helping to reduce water loss. Oenothera hardhamiae is part of the Onagraceae family and is known for its ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
